Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Park Central Dallas Texas”
Reviews.Author: smitht113
Reviews.Content: I just recently spend a week in Dallas and chose the Embassy Suites Park Central in Dallas Texas, I liked the fact that a room card was needed to access the room floors when using the evevator, Parking was in a gargage below the hotel Rooms are spacious didn't like the small space in the bathroom. Best room are on the back side of the hotel as room in front face the highway, Bar setting very freindly and relaxing, Happy hour pleasant

Reviews.Title: “No problems!”
Reviews.Author: SomewhereinTX
Reviews.Content: It could use some updating here and there, but it wasn't bad! The room was great! The beds were comfortable. The breakfast was outstanding! We didn't have any issues with the elevator. The pool area was adequate. There seemed to be a LOT of standing water in the pool room though. Maybe a drainage issue? It was crowded and loud, but we expected that on the weekend! My only complaint would be the bar/lounge. It closed really early for a weekend night. We went down to get a drink, and he was closing up shop. He was really friendly though, and he went ahead and got our drinks first! We would return!

Reviews.Title: “This Embassy needs some work”
Reviews.Author: ObLaDiObLaDa
Reviews.Content: I booked this Embassy for just one night. It has a good, central location in north Dallas. The main reason I have given this hotel only two stars is that it is messy. There was a persistent odor inside the hotel. The floors were dirty and the walls, floors, ceilings...just about everything is starting to show its age and is getting rough around the edges. I don't know what it is about Embassy's lately, but Hilton really needs to upgrade/repair/replace the elevators. They are slow and sometimes seem to have a mind of their own. Our room was fairly clean for the most part except for a foot long piece of toilet paper hanging from one of the fire sprinkler heads (I can't figure that one out except that maybe the housekeeper used toilet paper to clean it with and left it hanging up there in a rush). Also, there was a section of the ceiling that was missing. It was about 1' x 2' and had a green wire hanging out. It appeared that there was supposed to be a metal plate covering it. Very odd. The beds were clean, but the floor was not. But since we arrived fairly late at night, we just went to bed. The shower was very nice with alot of water pressure and plenty of heat. The afternoon managers reception was one of the weakest I've been to. Very slow and the food was of poor quality in my opinion. As a result, we decided to skip breakfast the next morning. As with most Embassy's I've been to, the service and employees were great. Always had a smile and were wanting to make our stay better. Unfortunately, they didn't have alot to work with at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money at last!”
Reviews.Author: Nemoandchina
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Embassy Suites Park Central for several reasons. We wanted to splurge a bit for our holiday, so wanted a place that was nice with good service. We were NOT disappointed! The hotel has just undergone a renovation in the common areas, and it was very tastefully done. The room was very comfortable, great beds, and our room was just off the atrium/lobby open area on the 7th floor...didn't hear a thing. Another reason for our choice was the location, with its proximity to some great shopping areas, and within a reasonable taxi fare zone to the night life in the Oak Lawn area. Being 12 miles away from our desired entertainment areas and based on some rather distasteful prior cabbies on various other trips, we were afraid we may get fare-robbed, but again, we were not disappointed ($20ish). There were a few very minor hiccups. We arrived on Wednesday evening, and were greeted by the wonderfully pleasant desk hostesses. After checking in, we naturally headed down to the lobby bar for the Managers Cocktail hour. The gentleman working the bar that evening (3/14 and Thursday 3/15) had a rather grouchy disposition who was put out by having to break off conversation with friends to wait on us lowly hotel guests, greeting each request with a scowl. Fortunately the servers for the remainder of our 4 night stay were very nice and polite. The other hiccup was that since it is such a large hotel, it evidently is very popular with large groups. The first two days and nights there was a big group of high schoolers there for a religious revival which was VERY loud, and also made the breakfast area a disaster area (great breakfasts by the way!!!!). Another night was invaded by a youth soccer league which turned the lobby area and elevators into a playground of uncontrolled children. But overall, this is a great property to stay at, and the few inconveniences caused by other guests (on our visit) are really overshadowed by how nice it actually is to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomma73
Reviews.Content: We visited Dalls during Spring Break and stayed at the Embassy Suites in the Park Central Area. I was a little worried based on the reviews I had read, but since I prefer Embassy over other hotel brands and the price was right on this one, I bit the bullet and made the reserverations. While I had good directions to get to the hotel, the interstate system in Dallas can be confusing. I can't hold this against Embassy since they didn't design the roads, but I wish there could have been an easier way to get there. We called around 6pm to let them know we were running a little late, and they told us they were overbooked and that it was a good thing we called. When we got there, the front desk staff were very nice and had our room keys waiting. Check-in was a breeze. The parking garage was not that scary, but difficult to nativigate as the entrance had this really steep hill and all the signs only pointed to the exit (which happened to be the entrance as well). But based on the front desk's recommendation on which elevator to take to be closer to our room, we found a spot parked and never had any problems with leaving our car there. Our room was nicely decorated--no spots on the carpet, no dirty towels or linens on the beds. Room didn't smell either. I loved the fact that the TV in the bedroom was mounted to the wall, which gave us full use of the top of the dresser. The layout was weird as the closet was right next to one of the beds. Not a big problem though. Just a little difficult to get around. Beds were comfortable as well. The breakfast was great, just as I expected it to be, as was the evening reception. Our iron didn't work, but when I called down and asked for a new one, they brought it right up. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen at an Embassy but it worked. Here are the problems I saw with our stay: (1) given the bathroom was so tiny, it would have been nice to have a towel rack. The only place to hang your towels was on the hook on the back of the door. (2) I saw a big roach in the bathroom on our first night there. However, I never saw another one the rest of our stay. (3) There were brown stains on the ceiling in 2 corners of the room by the windows. They looked liked water stains. (4) The computers in the business office were not that fast. (5) Website said there were renovations done recently, but I didn't see any. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this Embassy and would consider going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Dallas, Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: KAQuinn
Reviews.Content: This location was easy to find as it's adjacent to the north loop and 75 north. The room was very quiet and well furnished. I was surprised by how many people attended the evening cocktail party (free). The lobby is quite large and has many conversational groupings that seat 8 - 10 people, so it handled the people and facilitated conversation. The hotel shuttle even took us to a nearby restaurant and picked us up when we finished dinner (free). Breakfast was very generous with made-to-order omelets. The only downside was the fee for internet use. However, this was compensated for by having two free computers for guest use in the hotel business center. The staff couldn't have been nicer! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Low end of embassy suites...”
Reviews.Author: hamsterapm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, but it is not up to the same standard of other Embassy Suites that I have stayed in. The location was easy access, but the neighborhood is definitely not the best. The parking garage is cramped and you have to drive your vehicle up and down a steep entrance to the garage. The manager was carrying on a personal call on the phone as we were waiting to check out and we just had to wait until he finished before he checked us out. I probably would not return to this location for future staycations.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Beth N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on March 6, 2012 and I thought for $144 corporate rate this would be a really nice place to stay. I was wrong! The furniture in the lobby should have been a warning...stained with cigarette burns...was afraid to sit on it. I went down to the bar around 5:30 and sat immediately in front of the bartender...I think his name was John. It took me about 10 minutes to get his attention while he was drying glasses and asked for a margarita with silver patron. He doesn't even respond to me. I look at him again and was about to ask and he barks "I HEARD YOU". He then asks, " Are you staying in the hotel?" I said yes and he says well i can give you a happy hour maragarita. He hands me a drink (no salt tasted like sweet and sour no tequila). I overheard him tell someone how pissed off and annoyed he was. My collegues joined me a few minutes later and we left to go outside the hotel as we felt this was not a full service bar but a free happy hour bar and "John" just wanted to pour free beer and wine and get his tips. He was extremely rude!! The door to my room was scuffed up with a bunch of black marks - my room was ok until i looked in the bathroom. The towels under the sink were coated with about an inch of dust under there. I pulled one out and it left a dust path. It was disgusting and I gagged a little!! (Room 228 if you want to clean it) I looked above me and the vent was a rusty piece of metal on the ceiling. I was so grossed out I hardly slept. Please don't say here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: OtisEF
Reviews.Content: I tried to order something as simple as a soda from the front lobby area, as I walked up to the desk, the male receptionist at the counter was yelling 'What do you want?' as each person called the front desk for assistance...yes, right in front of me. So I asked about purchasing a soda, so he proceeded to swipe my card over and over again, and then mentions that my card doesn't work. So, I gave him another card, he continues with the same action. Then he tosses my card on the desk and says that it doesn't work either. The whole time I am there, he continues to yell 'What do you want?' as people continue to call the front desk. I find out 2 days later that there are multiple purchases made to both cards for the one soda, that I did not purchase by the way. I will not go back to this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, confusing garage, but good restaurant staff”
Reviews.Author: Member3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip, arrived in Dallas in the evening, and found this hotel difficult to find. The GPS took me through a number of residential areas, which could have been the GPS' fault but it made me laugh as I passed block after block of houses. Check-in was smooth. There are many elevators and the underground garage is confusing. Make a mental note of where you parked your car. The room was fine, clean, everything worked. The best part of the stay was the staff at the hotel restaurant. I planned to get my dinner to-go. When they said dinner would take 25 minutes, I asked them to call me when it was ready. They offered to bring dinner to my room at no additional charge. They did this without attitude, which was great. I saw the same employee at the complimentary breakfast the next morning. He recognized and greeted me. Again, a very nice personal touch. Because of this employee, I'd stay at this hotel again. Small kindnesses make a big difference!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this establishment”
Reviews.Author: JoWoo
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here. A lovely hotel with glass elevators. The atrium is very nice. Cocktail hour was good and they had a hostess going around asking if we needed anything and she would get us more drinks so we didn't have to stand in any line. Breakfast made-to-order was good too. You can't hardly beat the price when you have cocktails and a nice breakfast included. My 3 complaints are: (1) that our key cards stopped working before check-out time and we couldn't get back into our room or use the elevator from the lobby to get up to our room, so that ended up being quite an ordeal; (2) the clock was set ahead an hour (which we didn't notice that night) so we ended up getting up an hour earlier; (3) the room was 60 degrees when we arrived and we could not get that a/c to stop blowing cold air no matter how high we set the temperature. This was in room 712.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable and so disappointing for the brand”
Reviews.Author: tennesseine
Reviews.Content: I stay in Embassy Suites hotels on most business trips because I enjoy the larger rooms and the nice (free!) breakfast. I also like the fact that the experience is consistent, which is a plus on business travel. (Give me unique and quirky on my personal trips, but predictable on business ones!) I have rarely had bad experiences in Embassy Suites. Staff always seem kind, well trained and dedicated. So to experience an Embassy Suites like this one was such a disappointment. The ironic part is that I was actually expecting the polar opposite, given that they tout the fact that they just spent millions renovating the place. I shudder to think what a dump it must have been before...and I wonder where those millions went: 1) The fitness room was pathetic, with a handful of cardio machines, of which two were out of order the length of my stay. 2) The lobby frankly just smelled terrible. Being an ex-smoker, my sense of smell is somewhat debilitated, so the fact that even I could notice it means it must have been pretty bad. My colleague - who probably wished he had smoked to spare him from the stench - described it this way: "It's like a wet cat had a party in here, then died." 3) While the staff were quite friendly, they did seem to have a lot of coverage issues. At one point I called down for a wake-up call. No one answered at the front desk, even after repeated tries. The FRONT DESK. C'mon, really? I finally called the restaurant and asked if they knew how I could find someone. The person offered to take note of my requested wake-up time and send it to the front desk. Do I even need to point out the call never happened? 4) In the restaurant, a colleague and I waited over 1/2 hour just for some apps. These last two are, in my experience, usually indicative of a hotel management too cheap to hire sufficient staff. The first two are indicative of an ownership too cheap to maintain its property properly. Whatever the root cause, I certainly won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jean b
Reviews.Content: The rooms are similiar to most Embassy Suites but appeared a little smaller. The included breakfast was very good, with a good selection of fruit, made to order eggs, etc. again this is typical of Embassy Suites but this one seemed to have a better slection. The evening menu, however, was not as good. The manager, however, contacted me when I left via email and apologized. The location is not too far from downtown, it is about 10 minutes by taxi and about twenty five dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: kingofthehill81
Reviews.Content: This will be our second year visiting this hotel for my daughters birthday and couldn't imagine doing anything else! Being that my daughters birthday is in January it is hard to find cool things to do to celebrate her birthday! Last year we stumbled upon an idea to stay at a hotel with an indoor pool and hang out! It was a perfect idea to stay here. The happy hour is great for mom and I and the kids love swimming and eating pizza by the pool and to top it all off the complimentary breakfast with omelette bar is superb. The hotel is inexpensive and when you factor in free drinks and breakfast for a family of 4 the cost is minimal to none! It is a quite family and business friendly enviotment couldn't imagine staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: bronco837
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice now with absolutely no problems. Parking is sparse if you have an SUV, but you can park behind the hotel with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, AWESOME breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: slhannold
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The only thing I did not like about it - and all embassy suites for that matter - is the open elevators and the open walkways to the rooms. We were on one of the top floors and for me, it gave me the creeps! I was always scared I was going to fall. However, I would stay here again because the staff were very accomodating and nice - the bartender was great. They also had a complimentary HOT breakfast which was very good. The omelettes were great. Rooms were very comfortable and spacious. Good hotel, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “MY HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: shayna3579
Reviews.Content: I just came home from a 2 week stay at this hotel. This was my 6th or 7th stay there and as always it was perfect. The rooms are clean and fresh, well laid out. I found the beds to be great to fall into after a hard days work along with the pillows which I loved. The breakfast was always good and hot just what I needed to start my day. I cannot say enough about the staff there. They alway go above and beyond. I want to give a special thanks to Windsor and Mr. T. for all the wonderful stays I have had. They are a credit to the Hilton name and this is where they should send other manager to train in customer service. The front desk staff is awesome. They all addressed me by name coming and going, alway a smile on there faces. I travel alot and I am a diamond member, this by far is just agreat hotel. Don't listen to the bad reviews and if in Dallas see for yourself you will not be sorry. Thanks again for a great stay. I cannot wait to come back when traveling to Dallas. Mae Wells

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Shadow1207
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just OK. It was clean. The beds were not at all comfortable, too firm and terrible pillows. Also I did not enjoy breakfast. The rest of the hotel was nice though,and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Older but still nice”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler78
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good location if you need to be in the Park Central area or if you want a fairly central location between downtown and the northern suburbs. Easy access to the Central Expressway. The hotel is an older one but is kept up nicely. It's probably the only Embassy Suites I have ever been to where the parking is beneath the building and the room elevators go directly down to the garage. I like that. The indoor pool & hot tub are small and I thought the pool water might be a little bit murky, but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: Kathy/HoustonSuburb
Reviews.Content: Tastefully decorated, very clean, very fresh, and visually relaxing. The bedrooms are very large. New fluffy towels. The furnishings are up-to-date and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is ok...”
Reviews.Author: Asim S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok, nothing special. Location of the hotel is not great either. I have stayed there before but my last time I was bitten by bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: zebrasky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites- Park Central for 1 night recently. This hotel appears to have had a very nice makeover. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was very comfortable and clean. Had a very good night sleep, probally the best sleep I have had in a long time in a hotel. Manager's Reception was very nice. Breakfast the next morming was great and had many wonderful choices. Would not hesitate to stay here again when back in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel even with remodels”
Reviews.Author: lsutdw
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was a nice size and the living room allowed for a few visitors. The bathroom was way too small. The toilet was right next to the tub. My family liked the breakfast buffet. I don't eat from any buffet so I cannot comment. There were restaurants, shopping and theaters within a reasonable driving distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but nasty assistant front desk manager!”
Reviews.Author: cchTyler
Reviews.Content: Loved the layout of the hotel, loved the room, loved the breakfast and managers reception, even loved the staff.......except the girl who I guess is the assistant front desk manager. Nice looking younger black girl who looks the part, but has zero people skills! This girl made us feel completely unwelcome. She does not smile or engage you in any friendly conversation. I will be back, but I hope she won't be there. Windsor, the front desk manager said we aren't the first and won't be the last to complain about her people skills, but she doesn't make mistakes?? People skills are everything in the hotel biz. She needs a job that doesn't involve talking to people. Again, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: hr45
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and very spacious. My room had a king size bed and also a pull out couch and two big screen tvs. The bathroom was on the small side and the lighting was dim. I was on the highway side and could hear traffic a little bit, but it didn't bother me. The first night we were there, there was a bunch of high school cheerleaders staying and it was pretty noisy on those floors. The restaurant wasn't really a restaurant, it was just out in the open in the middle of the lobby. Breakfast was very well presented and the cooked to order omelets were delicious! I also saw police officers there during breakfast everyday. I feel like maybe the hotel gives the officers free breakfast?bWould definitely stay again if I'm back in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK not sure about the location”
Reviews.Author: bubb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the July 4th weekend for three nights. Service was fine, especially the employees working at breakfast who were friendly and efficient. Room was clean but not spotless. Atrium is large and comfortable for group gatherings. We saw many large family groups over the weekend and everyone seemed to be having a good time. My only real concern here was the hotel's location. A major highway runs directly in front of it. We accessed the property from a back driveway, and the neighborhood was not great. The hotel is next to an empty office building. We saw several police cars lying in wait one day in the parking lot and back drive, which did not inspire confidence in the safety of the place. That said, we had no problems during our stay. Loved the TVs in the booths at beakfast. Our room was at the end of the hall, away from the atrium, and so it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back soon.”
Reviews.Author: Jerri215
Reviews.Content: Marijean is a Jewel she worked effortlessly to get me a block of 10 rooms with little notice. I arrived early and checked each room in without any problems, then proceeded to the managers reception. Very nice touch and good drinks. Our entire stay was enjoyable, the rooms were very comfy, front desk personal was always helpful, breakfast buffett (NYOB) was great. I personally also enjoyed the workout room after eating such a tasty and fulfilling breakfast. It was an awesome stay and with 24 people in our group and no complaints, that says a lot for the hote. and staff.. Keep up the good work and atmoshere of the hotel. Thanks .

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL TO STAY AT IN DALLAS”
Reviews.Author: shayna3579
Reviews.Content: I am a diamond member and have traveled all over the country and I have to say this is the best hotel I have stayed at. The hotel itself is so nice and the rooms are great. The hotel is very clean and well kept with great housekeeping. Beds made for a great night sleep and it was very quiet for all the guest that were there. Breakfast is hot, fresh and very good. The staff is warm, friendly and could not be more helpful. A special thanks to the manager Windsor Williams for making me feel like I have a home away from home. He always has a smile and you can see how much he is liked by guest and staff. Anyone who has a bad thing to say about this hotel cannot be pleased. On the other hand I am hard to please and I have to say I could not find anything wrong, just a great stay. If you need a great hotel with a great staff this should where you stay. I cannot wai to go back

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE TO STAY. NEED IMPROVEMENT IN THE GYM”
Reviews.Author: orthoclick
Reviews.Content: We were housed for 7 days in this hotel (my wife and kids of 16 and 7), The staff was very friendly and tried to help us in any occasion. The room was fine, althought the bathroom was some kind of a small place (maybe is ok for a couple, but is not for a family) We usually love sports and gym facilities, in this case, this is not the right place. Need improve in fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Bother”
Reviews.Author: summersd
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a small 'Stay-cation' during spring break and someone suggested this facility. What a mistake! The rooms were nice other than the broken cabinet door in the kitchenette that the maintenance guy came to fix at 8:30 at night (we never asked for the repair). There was a kid's party being held in the pool area - complete with a bunch of crock pots! and so many kids in the pool my 3 wouldn't even get in the water. The 'free' drinks was a joke. Took over 30 minutes to get one because there was one woman making them in a tiny alcove in the corner. The food in the dining room sucked so bad we just walked away from it. Husband's steak was a hockey puck even tho he asked for it medium rare. It took 30 minutes to get waited on and then another 45 for the food to show up - cold! We never got a refill on water, in fact he never came back after taking the order. Someone else delivered the food. The waiter spent more time talking to the bartender than he did serving. There were kids running all over the place - on every floor it seemed like there were screaming running kids and the noise just echoed through the entire place. We had planned to stay for 2 nights but went home after the first. Ick! What a terrible experience. The front desk staff was great but that couldn't come near making up for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Best Embassy Suites We Have Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: Akalliecat
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 year old son and I spent the night at this Embassy Suites and had a wonderful time. The hotel is located right off the highway and you have to park in a lower parking garage, but we never felt unsafe. The hotel just recently underwent a $12.3 million transformation and all I can say is WOW! It is very nice inside and it has a very relaxing atmosphere. There are flat screens everywhere, including booths where you can have your cooked to order breakfast in the morning, which by the way was very good. We arrived just a few minutes after the Evening Manager's Reception had ended and the bartender was nice enough to allow my husband and I to have one cocktail before ending it. The hotel staff were all very friendly, which is very important to us. The room was very nice and clean as well. There were two 37" flat screen tv's and it had one of the most comfortable beds that I have slept on at any hotel ever. If there was one thing that I would change about the hotel, it would be the size of the towels that they have at the swimming pool. We have stayed at quite a few Embassy Suites and usually you will find regular sized towels at their pools. At this Embassy Suites, they had very small towels and I did overhear a few people complaining about that. Other than that, it was a perfect stay and I am sure that we will be back again. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice, comfortable and relaxing place to staff with friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: flieswithkids
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews, but this turned out to be the perfect place to stay during our Christmas trip to see relatives in Dallas. The suite was spacious, clean, and updated, and the public spaces were all well kept and up-to-date. Our 3 and 6-year-old kids loved the breakfast buffet (the omelet chef was very patient with their creative compositions) and the pool, which was warm and not crowded. The gym was first rate - one of the best I've seen in a business hotel. It was close to the highway, which was great for us. We were on the top floor, and it wasn't at all noisy. The underground garage was perfectly adequate - I wouldn't leave your car unlocked and full of valuables, but I never felt unsafe - in fact, with key-card elevator access to the hotel, it was much better than expected. We ended up checking out a night early (kids were ready to be home playing with their new toys) and they didn't charge us for that night, even though it was LONG after the checkout time. All in all, a great experience - we'll stay there on every trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: cottage229
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel from 9/21 thru 10/18. tim, candi, both mark(s), valencia, courtney, sara, mr. t (and more!) couldn't have been more accommodating. housekeeping were on their toes even on several sold out days. if you're a polite/thoughtful traveler, you will get everything that you expect and more - will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ldknerr
Reviews.Content: Your typical Embassy Suites. Clean, comfortable rooms. Great location for getting onto major highways into and out of Dallas. Excellent restaurants within a few miles. The only complaint is that there are no posted hours for the bar and it will close without warning if not busy.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated, but not new”
Reviews.Author: Ranger215
Reviews.Content: Large Suite hotel in a not-so-good location, from a neighborhood perspective as well as due to the fact it's directly facing the big High-5 road crossing. Flat TVs everywhere, 2 large one's in the room, but also in the breakfast/bar area. Rooms refurbished, as well as main area; however bathrooms still old; breakfast okay, as well as bar service (afternoon happy-hour); parking garage with direct hotel access, but does appear in poor condition; all in all okay, but not really good

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Geeseland
Reviews.Content: I spent about 25 nights in this hotel in the past year and have to say it is a great place for business travelers. It is close to the major expressways and many good restaurants. The service has always been good and I can recommended it. If your looking for a vacation hotel this is really not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leighc79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a quick weekend trip. We stayed at Embassy, because I have always had wonderful experiences. This trip was no different. The rooms were nice, the bed was very comfortable. The cooked to order breakfast is a great! I would reccommend this hotel and we will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to like this hotel - it just didn't happen”
Reviews.Author: RedRaider97
Reviews.Content: I love Embassy Suites. When I can I try to stay at them. So I was excited when I found that this hotel was close to my client. I booked it and looked forward to a typical nice stay at yet another Embassy Suites. I have to admit I was disappointed. I stayed at this hotel 6 times in the past year hoping it would improve. It didn't. I cannot give this hotel a solid recommendation - look around the area for another hotel. The good news is that most of my complaints are fixable and hopefully the hotel will see to them. Pros: It's an Embassy Suites, so it has some 'pros' right off the bat. Free breakfast that is still sets the bar high for other hotel chains. The lobby is beautiful and well decorated. They have put some money into adding water-art that really gives you a calm feeling when you walk in. They have free parking (which in this area is rare). The hotel is pretty secure in that you must use your room key to use the elevator (except for the lobby level). The staff is very friendly and helpful and always enjoyable to talk with. Cons: Rooms - the beds are pretty bad. Several of the rooms I slept in had the "dip" in the mattress. The sofa in the room was consistently bad - i had to use pillows to give added cushion so that I wouldn't feel the sofa frame. Most of the time my room was clean, but on one occasion I found a piece of gum stuck to the headboard. It was bright green and hard (so it had been there a while) and was the first thing I saw when I walked in the room. I stayed in several rooms that had stained carpet. Bathrooms - at first I thought it was just the one room I had, but I noticed after a while that every bathroom has some kind of leak/drip coming from the ceiling. I even noticed that each bathroom had some rust on the ceiling (near the metal access panel). At least the showers were nice. Gym - This was a frustrating point for me. The main thing in a gym that I use is the bike. When I first got to the hotel I noticed it didn't work. I told the front desk and they said they'd have someone come fix it. 3 weeks went by and the bike wasn't fixed. I left Dallas for a few months and when I returned the bike still wasn't fixed. I stayed there recently (3 weeks ago) and the bike still hasn't been fixed. What's worse is that this last trip the room had to be 80 degrees with no access to the thermostat. This is one of the main reasons I gave up on this hotel. There are other hotels in the area for the same price that have working amenities. I didn't expect the bike to be fixed immediately, but I did expect it to get fixed after a few months.

Reviews.Title: “A Non-Smoker's Hell, Discourteous Service.”
Reviews.Author: skugar29
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were in Dallas for one night and decided to stay at Embassy Suites. We trusted the brand and trusted that it would be good. Upon entering our room, we were blown away by the encompassing scent of cigarette smoke. It was the worst smell of smoke I'd ever experienced, and we knew we'd have a headache fast if we had to stay there. We went down to request a non-smoking room, and were promptly told that there was no where else to put us and that we had to stay there. Needless to say, we suffered through a night of headaches, sleeplessness and stench. Will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Guns drawn, funky smell, great omelets”
Reviews.Author: FamilyofSix_Colorado
Reviews.Content: My husband, four kids (9 thru 16) and I stayed overnight here during a long road trip to see Grandma. We've had good experiences with Embassy Suites and expected a great stay here too. Our stay had some good points and some not so good. It started on a bad note. We pulled under the overhang to unload our bags before checking in and an employee quickly met us there saying, "We need all of you to step inside for safety because there's an incident." "An incident?" my husband asks "Yes, I need you all to come inside!" So, leaving the minivan right there in the front entrance (and locking it!), we scurry inside and I ask the manager at the desk, "Uh, what is going on?" He said that the police were just outside and there were "guns drawn" and the police told the Embassy Suites to keep everyone inside. Looking down the hall, we could see blue lights coming in the window and sure enough, there were several police and a shady, handcuffed character was being forced in the back of one of the police cars. Not the welcome we expected. Of course, what goes on outside the hotel is beyond the staff's control, but it IS in a seedy part of town. The hotel seemed to have some extra security. For example, you have to use your card-key to go up in the elevator. I am assuming the staircase also required this but I don't know because we didn't use the stairs. All the staff we encountered on our visit were professional and kind. The air in the lobby, in fact in all common areas, smelled a bit funky. I think it smelled like ethnic hair products, but perhaps it was just a different cleaner than I am used to. Not a bad smell, but pervasive. That was weird. Our room was okay and looked "surface clean." I saw some grunge on the toilet so I took a wet washcloth and little shampoo and wiped the surfaces that we were going to touch (handles, flushers, toilet seat, doors) down and got a lot of gunk on my washcloth. The TV remote didn't work but maintenance traded it out for a good one. The TVs (one in each room) come on at top volume regardless of the last volume used. The two double beds were soft, clean, and comfortable. The fold out bed (where I slept) was clean but very bumpy with its thin mattress. When someone in another room shuts their room door (the one to the common hall area) it echoes and we heard a lot of booming from this at bedtime. But it subsided. The pool was nice but crowded on the night we were there. There were plenty of towels and the pool appeared clean (I read online that the only pools germier than hotel pools are day care pools, ewwww). There was a sizeable puddle of standing water though in a low area of the floor. We like Embassy Suites for breakfast as their custom omelets can't be beat. The omelets were yummy but some other available food wasn't so great. The vat of oatmeal was very soupy and nobody wanted it but the grits in the next vat over were excellent. The hash browns were tasty but the pancakes were awful as they were room temperature, dry, and had hard edges. They must've been frozen and overcooked in the microwave. The juice dispenser was out during our visit and we could see workers scurrying around to fix it but we didn't get juice with our breakfast. As we were leaving the breakfast area, they had just set up two big coolers with hand-lettered signs saying, "Orange Juice." The coffee was decent. Overall it was a decent stay although there were some glitches. The drawn guns and funky smell to the air are enough to have us look elsewhere next time we make this same drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the presidential suite at the Embassy Suites Park Cental Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: jaywrkbus25
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I plus her girlfriend and husband stayed at the embassy suites park central dallas. The presidential suite was huge. My wife and I had are own separate bedroom-bath and are friends had their own as well. The living room was spacious. The room included a fridge (about double the size of the regular room.) The table had plenty of room for the four of us to eat. In the evening we enjoyed the free drinks at the managers reception. In the morning we filled up at the cook to order breakfast. It was nice to relax in the pool-hot tub area. Overall everyone had a good time. It was nice to catch up with old friends at a great hotel. The free drinks and free breakfast make it a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: chop144
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, good location for the price. This hotel is all about value, not expenive, free parking, free breakfast and they offer free breakfast. The breakfast is a cook to order one, not a buffet or continental breakfast. All rooms are suites, which is great for families and business travellers needing to spread out. I would recommend this hotel but would also state that the area behind the hotel is a tad shady and too lock up all valuables, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great and not-so Great”
Reviews.Author: mesquitemachine
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. I like the renovated front desk area where the agent is not behind a static desk, but each computer has it's own 'island'. Agent was friendly and quick (but thourough), and answered all of my questions with a smile. My wife and I headed down to the lobby for the manager's reception at around 6pm. We saw many people in the lobby area around the bar with drinks, so assumed that the complimentary beverages were being sold at the bar. After the bartender asked me if I would like to charge the drinks to my room, I realized that we were in the wrong place. No worries, the bartender directed us to the proper location. Two lines were formed - one for beer/wine and one for mixed cocktails. After overhearing the servers tell many people in front of us that they were only giving out one drink at a time per person, when it came to be our turn, I ordered a drink and the server made it quickly and turned to my wife, who promptly ordered the same thing. This time, the bartender rolled his eyes at her, made the drink, and set the drink down rather forcefully onto the counter. I'm not sure what the deal was with this guy - perhaps he was ending a rather long and troubling day, but to me - working in the Hospitality Industry myself - that this type of frustration should NEVER be displayed in front of a guest. Needless to say, my wife immediately turned around from the bar WITHOUT her drink and we promptly went somewhere else for our cocktails. Other than that experience, our stay at the Embassy Suites Park Cities went absolutely flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty standard Embassy - which is a good thing”
Reviews.Author: TravelinDave209
Reviews.Content: I've stayed multiple times in the last few years. They do a nice job. Front desk is OK, if sometimes a bit slow. Evening reception is excellent - bartender does a good job. Breakfast also excellent with made-to-order omelets, french toast, etc. Rooms and lobby have been recently redone and are nice. The parking garage isn't pretty -- cramped and often wet. But, it is a parking garage after all. This is a good spot for business stays. Local restaurants are very good - steak, cajun seafood, mexican. Can't comment on families. Doesn't seem like a lot to do in the immediate area. Ask for a room away from the highway - it's consistently noisy on that side. This hotel is my first choice in the north central Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Received better service at the Taco Bell down the street!”
Reviews.Author: framirez60
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst Hilton/Embassy Suites Experiences I have ever had! I am not normally one to complain, but I had to have words with the night manager, Eugene, at the hotel over the service. First of all I could not get a hold of anyone in maintenance and the phones would just go to a voicemail. Secondly, room service took 45 minutes to bring us some plates and silverware. Finally, when I tried to call the front dest the phone transferred me to reservations. After finally reaching the fron desk the manager on duty, Eugene, was very short and interrupted me several times while I tried to explain what I was needing. Finally, after a 10 minute conversation in which I had to be a little more forceful he becaume more understanding and had my requests fulfilled in fifteen minutes. I don't know if they were just short handed or if it was a bad night, but the service was absolutely the worst I have ever experienced at a hotel that is known for quality. I received better service from the teenager at the Taco Bell down the street. The quality of the rooms and the value was decent, but I would never stay here again. When checking out the front desk could nto remove an erroneous charge for internet service and could not produce a receipt nor could they correct the charges after charging the wrong card. If you do not plan on working with the hotel staff at all maybe this is the place for you, but if you are used to prompt and courteous service you will be quite dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JCSmith09
Reviews.Content: Due to not double-checking information, the front desk gave my room to another person with the same name, and used my credit card to pay for their room. They finally found me a room so I went to park. While driving around to find a parking place, I noticed that the back gate had written in spray paint, "[--] Gringos." Then, because they have a parking garage and parking for large vehicles is limited, as I drive an F350, I was told there would be nowhere for me to park until 10:00PM ... are you kidding?!? Because of all the circumstances, I decided to cancel my reservation, and they STILL charged me for one night's stay. Business with them was far beyond unpleasant, and the area is quite unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hernfam
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Recently remodeled and it looks great!! Rooms were very nice. Beds were awesome. The lobby/breakfast/evening area is great. Lots of tables, couch etc. It was a great place to get together with other family members. The staff was very helpful and provided excellent service. Don't normally eat at hotels but the food was very good. Pool and gym were very good. Kids loved the pool. The gym had new equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Vehicle stolen - Area is unsafe - crime is very high”
Reviews.Author: LesandRon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on the new renovations and the reviews on this site. As a frequent traveler - I take a very long time checking out facilities and reading reviews. One thing I DO NOT DO is google the address and do a crime check of the area. I will be doing this in the future. A hotel can be beautiful and serve a great breakfast however when you park your vehicle 3 parking spots from the front door and you walk out to leave and your car is gone - SHOCKED! It had been stolen at 6:45 that morning based on the security tape from the hotel. The hotel informed us that they have one security person from 10 pm to 6 am. Check the crime in this area and they should have a police officer on site for the safety of their customers. I am ashamed that I put my family at such a great risk and will continue to work on finding a way in which hotels can alert potential customers of the crime in the area. Any suggestions towards this would be helpful. Please DO NOT STAY HERE DUE TO THE CRIME RATE.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Embassy Suites I've stayed in the past 20 years.”
Reviews.Author: imssc1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the Texas-OU football weekend. The reviews were mixed, so my expectations were not high. The hotel exceeded my expectations and then some. We were warmly greeted at check in. Our room was ready even though we were early. The parking garage is a plus, in that the elevator takes you from the garage to the floor where your room is. The hotel was recently renovated, so there is a large flat panel TV in the bedroom, new carpet, wallpaper,etc. The staff at breakfast were friendly, and they even have flat screen TV's at the booths for breakfast. The lobby area was very comfortable. Even though this was a football weekend, there was NO running up and down the halls or kids playing in the elevators, like at the other hotels. They even had two armed security guards in the lobby through out the night. Location is great. If you want big bathrooms, stay at another hotel and expect to pay four times the price, and $25-35 for breakfast, rather than enjoy the free one at this hotel. All in all, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Misha22
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Embassy Suites in Park Central. No complaints at all. The lobby is inviting and the rooms were spacious and recently remodeled. Two big flat screen TVs in the room. Very clean and quiet. Some have commented that the bathrooms are small. For a solo traveler, I had no issues and even with another person, it seems more than adequate. I suppose a family might find it on the small side but I've certainly stayed at some Hilton chains where the space between the toilet and closing the door is miniscule and this wasn't that bad. There was a lot of counter space in the bathroom and a shelf below the counter to store items. Surprisingly, there was no bathtub, just a shower stall (albeit a spacious shower stall). Would definitely stay here again if in the area for business.

Reviews.Title: “The typical Embassy Suites experience”
Reviews.Author: erikdane
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this property for 3 nights in August 2009 and were very pleased with both the facilities and the personnel. The rooms were very nice; however, our family's favorite part was the very warm pool. It was perhaps the warmest indoor pool I have experienced, which is very nice when you take a toddler! Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and will most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the good and the bad and the...........”
Reviews.Author: aloha200903
Reviews.Content: reading all the reviews i was very worried. there is good...... lobby and atrium are BEAUTIFUL. suites are..........well.........suites. so they are nice. BATHROOMS on the other hand are TINY. all this wonderful room in the suite but NO ROOM in the bathroom, open the door and you are standing in front of the toilet and in front of the sink. toilet is up against the tub. shower curtain is in your lap. manager happy hour is nice but people come in dripping from the pool and it's a mess. from what i have read........yes there are temperature issues. living room was good, but bedroom was stuffy/warm. YES i did get a DIRTY GLASS at the manger's reception. not just hazy dirty but "glob of cheese" dirty. GROSS. floors by the pool stay wet and not cleaned up. elevators the same. i think they are trying to improve.........but need more work. a "manager type" was cleaning up tables, etc. hire some help already. room was really nice, beds were nice. we were by the freeway, not much bad noise. yes it is basement parking, but not bad situation. wish they had outdoor pool. overall, not terrible, but the little things (cleanliness) ...........kinda make a huge difference. registration staff SUPER helpful and nice every time we had questions. eat at papasitos! YUM! ok that's the long and short of it. questions, let me know! good location for jumping on 635 or 75. not a bad place to stay. just note the down sides to it. i would stay up north in Allen next time, personally.

Reviews.Title: “Ghastly, Horrible, Filthy hotel - Stay away !!”
Reviews.Author: iluv2travelBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 weeks ago and it was a disaster. They are claiming that the room they gave me is newly-renovated. Renovated??Hello???! The room was horrible! The furniture are tacky. They are uncomfortable, disgusting and cheap-looking. Also, the room was not properly cleaned - there are hairs in the bathroom. The breakfast area was filthy! The parking area (basement) was sickening- it's flooded with water! What a waste of money!! I should have just stayed in a Motel 6 - they are much better than this hotel! I defnitely would never come back at this one - even if they pay me!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Decision”
Reviews.Author: mnveil
Reviews.Content: I was booked in this hotel for three nights, but could only take it for one. I agree with another reviewer that this hotel does not meet Hilton standards and I cannot understand how it can have an â€œEmbassy Suitesâ€� sign on the front. I arrived very late and entered my room which was reeked of stale cigarette smoke, moisture problems, and disinfectant. It was a non-smoking room. The room dÃ©cor and fixtures were in serious need of updating, adding to the dingy feel already created by the dim lighting and yellowed ceiling from years of tobacco smoke. The sheets on the bed were old and thin, and the pillows were in bad need of replacement. The good news: There appear to be renovations taking place, so if you end up going to this hotel is may be worth asking for an updated room at check in. I was so turned off I found another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: or1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the Hilton website assuming this was up to Hilton standards. This was not even up to Motel 6 standards. The room smelled of disinfectant, the heating/air conditioning system was loud, the control impossible to manipulate, resulting in swings of temperature from hot to cold. The fan in the bathroom was so noisy it was better to bathe in the dark. The wireless internet would not work. When reported to the front desk, I was treated more rudely than I have been in many years. We originally booked a two night stay and left after one horrible night. Hilton should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!!!!!!! Cant believe this is a Embasy Suites Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oviedos1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in HORRIBLE shape! There was blood on the walls, the TV had speakers that were blown and you couldnt change the volume to even turn it down. They replaced the TV with another piece of junk TV. I stay in the Embassy suites on purpose but I wont anymore. I told Hilton about my experience and all I got was a cheesy generic email saying I was already contacted and I WAS NOT CONTACTED. My belongings were stolen from the room, the elevators were broken, there were a lot of angry people staying there, it was HORRIBLE

Reviews.Title: “Will not return. Don't go on New Year's Eve and expect Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Dallas20something
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the hotel thinking that it would be a quite getaway from fireworks in our neighborhood on New Year's Eve. Boy were we wrong. The hotel is open in the middle, so all of the noise from the lobby, restaurant, etc. is heard by every room in the hotel. There were people yelling, loud blow horns, and screems all night long. We complained to the management, but they told me that it was new year's eve, and that the other loud people were guests. I told them that I was a guest as well and asked them to tell people to be quiet. They did not. It was the worst night I have ever stayed in a hotel. The room itself was okay, but the management's service was deplorable. I left an angry comment note the following morning at check-out and did not receive a phone call or a response. I will never stay at this hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites Hotel Dallas - Park Central Area
HotelInfo.Address: 13131 North Central Expressway, Dallas, TX 75243
